translated: Record of Monasteries South of Luoyang, Volume 3
Composed by Yang Xuanzhi, Cavalry General of the Wei Dynasty
Jingming Temple. It was established by Emperor Xuanwu. It was built in the Jingming era and thus took that as its name.
It is one li outside Xuan Yang Gate, east of the imperial road.
The temple is 500 steps from east to west, south to north.
In front, it faces Mount Song and Mount Shao.
Behind, it overlooks the imperial city.
Green trees hang their shadows.
Green waters form patterns.
It is a land of outstanding scenery.
Fresh and uniquely beautiful.
The suspended hall in the mountain shines brightly with over a thousand rooms.
Interlocking and facing each other.
Blue terraces and purple pavilions.
Floating paths connect to each other.
Although there are four seasons outside,
inside there is no cold or heat.
Outside the eaves of the rooms,
all are mountains and ponds.
Bamboo, pine, orchid, and iris,
hang down in rows on the steps.ğŸ”½Gathering the wind and dew,
flowing fragrance and exuding fragrance.
In the Zhengguang years,
The Empress Dowager first built a seven-storied floating tower,
one hundred feet above the ground.
Therefore, Xing Zicai's stele inscription says:
Hearing the thunder from afar, and the stars running by the side.
The decorations were splendid,
comparable to Yongning.
Golden discs and jeweled bells shone in the clouds.
The temple had three ponds,ğŸ”½where aquatic plants such as water chestnuts, lotus roots, and lotus flowers grew.
Sometimes yellow-shelled purple-scaled fish emerged from the dense algae.
Green-backed white geese floated and submerged in the green water.
Grinding and threshing were all done using water power.
The temple's marvelousness was the best among all.
At that time, people loved to promote blessings.
On the seventh day of the fourth month, all the statues in the capital came to this temple.
The Ministry of Education recorded the statues.
There were over a thousand statues.
By the eighth month festival,ğŸ”½they entered Xuan Yang Gate in order.
Facing the palace in Chang'an.
They received the emperor's scattering of flowers.
At that time, the golden flowers reflected the sun.
The jeweled canopies floated like clouds.
The banners and canopies were like a forest.
The incense smoke was like a mist.
The Buddhist music and Dharma sounds
shook the heavens and earth.
The hundred performances soared and soared,
crowding together wherever they were.
The famous monks and virtuous assembly carried their staffs in groups.
The faithful disciples and Dharma companions held flowers to form a thicket.
The carriages and horses filled the streets.
The prosperity and abundance were overwhelming.
At that time, there was a Hu monk from the Western Regions.
Seeing this, he exclaimed, It is a Buddha land!
By the Yongxi years,
he was ordered to write the stele inscription for the temple.
Zicao was a person from Hejian.
His character was intelligent and his temperament was elegant and refined.
He pondered deeply,
learning the old and knowing the new.
In the academy of literature, he surpassed Ban Gu and Ma Rong, standing alone at the top.
His outstanding model surpassed Xu Gan and Guo Xiang, standing alone at the highest point.
Therefore, the scholars in robes and caps crowded at his door.
The guests who cherished the Way came and went, filling the room.
Those who ascended his hall
were as if they were entering the gate of Confucius.
Those who received his rewards,
Still listened to the sentences of the Eastern Wu.
He was very famous at that time.
His reputation spread far and near.
In the Zhengguang period, he untied his robe and was summoned by Emperor Xuan as a gentleman for court duty.
He was soon promoted to secretary-chancellor and gentleman of the palace gate.
His son was well-versed in learning and had extensive knowledge, understanding everything.ğŸ”½He inquired about the military and state system, and there was nothing he did not investigate.
When the imperial palace became unstable,
The studies at the Tiger Gate were discontinued.
Later, he was transferred to the director of the Imperial University, instructing the students in the upper school.
His son punished laziness and rewarded diligence.
He devoted his whole mind to encouraging and guiding.
The students in the blue-robed class,
In the end, cherished the elegant methods.
The style of the Zisi and Mengzi,
Here it revived and flourished.
At the end of the Yongxi period,
He resigned due to his mother's old age.
The emperor did not approve it.
His son earnestly pleaded with utmost sincerity.
His tears fell together with his words.
The emperor then granted his request.
He issued an edict to make him a grand master for splendid happiness.
To return to his private garden to take care of his mother.
Five servants were provided for the place where he was born.
Once a year, he would be summoned to the court to consult on matters.
The kings and lords would pay their respects to him, like the Han court sending off the two Shu.
When the imperial residence was moved to Ye,
civil disputes became numerous.
The previous regulations and later edicts
contradicted each other.
The legal officials had doubts and the case records piled up like mountains.
The emperor ordered Zicao and Neizi Sheng to compile the new regulations of the Linzhi, in fifteen chapters.
The provincial government used them to resolve doubts.
The prefectures and counties used them as the basis for governance.
During the Wuding period,
he was appointed as the General of the Piao Cavalry and the Governor of Xiyanzhou.
His governance was clear and peaceful.
The officials and people were at ease with him.
Later, he was summoned to be the Minister of the Secretariat.
At that time, the war horses were at the outskirts,
and the court had many affairs.
The state rituals and court ceremonies all came from Zicao.
The poems, fu,ğŸ”½imperial edicts, letters,
stele inscriptions, praises, and records
that he composed, totaling five hundred pieces,
were all passed down to the world.
The neighboring countries admired his model.
The court and the people considered it a beautiful story.
Datong Temple, Zhaofu Temple, the two temples of the Qin Taishi Gong, and ShuangnÃ¼ Temple. Datong Temple.
To the west of Jingming Temple, also known as Limin Lane.
To the south, there was the residence of Gao XianlÃ¼e, a clerk of the Three Offices.
Every night, he saw red light.
Moving in front of the hall.
Like this, not just once. When digging a foot into the ground,
he obtained a hundred jin of gold.
The inscription said:
This is the gold of Su Qin's family. Whoever finds it should create merit for me.
XianlÃ¼e then built Zhaofu Temple.
People said this land was the old residence of Su Qin.
At that time, Yuan Yi held power.
Hearing of his gold discovery, he went to Luoyang to demand it.
Giving him twenty jin.
Xuanzhi investigated.
At the time of Su Qin, there was no Buddhism yet.
Merit does not necessarily refer to temples.
It should be inscriptions and other such things praising his achievements.
In the east, there are two temples built by the Grand Mentor of the Qin Dynasty.
Located one li south of Jingming Temple.ğŸ”½The western temple was established by the Empress Dowager.
The eastern temple was built by the Emperor's aunt.
Both were built to seek blessings for their fathers.
Therefore, they were named after them.
At that time, people called them the Twin Nuns' Temples.
Both temples bordered the Luo River.
The trees were lush, with leaves covering the sky.
Each had a five-story pagoda.
Fifty zhang tall.
The craftsmanship was exquisite.
It was comparable to Jingming Temple.
On the six days of each month,
there was always a eunuch in charge.
He oversaw the monks' quarters.
He provided offerings and supplies.
No other temple could match it.
To the east of the temple, there was a terrace.
Although the foundation was dilapidated,
it was still over five zhang tall.
This was built by Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty.
To the east of the terrace was the Bieyong Garden,
which was established by Emperor Wu of the Wei Dynasty.
In the Zhengguang era of our dynasty,
the Mingtang Hall was built southwest of the Bieyong Garden.
The upper part is round and the lower part is square.
There are eight windows and four doors.
The Prince of Runan also built a brick stupa on top of the Spirit Terrace.
In the first year of Xiaochang, the country was invaded by bandits from all sides.
The states and prefectures lost their bases.
The court set up a recruitment office to raise troops.
It was set up to the north of the hall.
Those who joined the army.
Were appointed as generals of the wilderness, vice generals, and assistant generals.
At that time, the armored soldiers were called the Mingtang team.
At that time, there was a tiger guard named Luo Ziyan who claimed to be.
A person from Luoyang.
In the past, during the Xiaochang years, he was stationed in Pengcheng.
A fellow soldier of his named Fan Yuanbao obtained leave to return to the capital.
Ziyan gave him a letter to deliver to his family, saying.
The house was located south of the Spirit Terrace.
Near the Luo River.
You just go there.
My family will come out to meet you.
Yuanbao did as he was told.
He went to the south of the Spirit Terrace.
There was not a single house to ask about.
He hesitated and was about to leave.
Suddenly he saw an old man coming.
Where did you come from? he asked. Why are you wandering here?
Tell me everything about it.
The old man said,
This is my son.
He took the letter and led Yuanbao inside. They saw
a spacious hall and beautiful rooms.
They sat down and ordered a maid to get wine.
In a moment, the maid carried in a dead child.
Yuanbao was very surprised at first.
Soon the wine arrived, and it was very red.
It smelled fragrant and was unusual.
They also set out delicacies,
with both sea and land products.
After drinking, they took their leave to return.
The old man saw Yuanbao out and said,
It will be difficult to meet again later.
He felt sad and sorrowful.
They said goodbye very sincerely.
The old man went back inside.
Yuanbao no longer saw the gate or alley.
He only saw a high bank facing the water, with green waves tilting to the east.
He only saw a fifteen-year-old boy,
who had just drowned and died, with blood coming out of his nose.
Only then did he realize that the wine he had drunk was the boy's blood.
and returned to Pengcheng.
Zi Yuan was already lost.
Yuan Bao and Zi Yuan were stationed together for three years.
They did not know it was the spirit of the Luo River.
Baode Temple, Wenjue Temple, Sanbao Temple, Ningyuan Temple, Chengguang Temple, Zhengjue Temple, Baode Temple.
It was established by Emperor Xiaowen of the Gaozu.
To repay the kindness of the Empress Dowager.
Three miles outside the Kaiyang Gate, on the imperial road east of the Kaiyang Gate, there was the Han National Academy.
In front of the hall, there were stone scriptures of three kinds of characters.
Twenty-five steles were engraved inside and out.
The Spring and Autumn Annals and the Book of History were copied in two parts.
The seal script, the kaishu style, and the clerical script were used in three kinds of characters.
The Han Right General Cai Yong wrote them with his brush, and the traces remain.
There are still eighteen steles.
The rest have been damaged.
There are also forty-eight stone steles.
The Book of Changes, the Book of History, the Gongyang Commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals, and the Book of Rites were written in clerical script inside and out.
There is also a stele for reading books.
They are all in front of the hall.
Emperor Wen of the Wei Dynasty wrote the Canon and said that the stele
Existed until the 17th year of the Taihe era.
The Gaozu named it the Encouragement to Learning District.
Within the district, there are the Wenjue Three Treasures and Ningyuan Three Temples.
In the 4th year of the Wuding era,
The General moved the stone scriptures to Ying.
There is a garden around it,
And precious fruits come out of it, including large valley pears.
The Chengguang tangerine.
Chengguang Temple also has many fruit trees.
The taste of the tangerines is very delicious.
It is the best in the capital city.
To the east of the Encouragement to Learning District is the Yanxian District.
Within the district, there is the Zhengjue Temple.
It was established by Wang Shu, the Minister of the Court of State Ceremonials.
Shu's courtesy name was Gongyi.
He was a person from Langya.
He was the son of Huan, the Prefect of Yongzhou of the pseudo-Qi state.
He was well-versed in studies and had extensive knowledge.
His talent and eloquence were beautiful and prosperous.
He served as the Vice Director of the Imperial Secretariat of Qi.
In the 18th year of the Taihe era, he betrayed the state and returned to submission.
At that time, Gaozu had newly established the city of Luoyang.
He had made many rules and regulations.
Sengjiu had extensive knowledge of past events.
He was of great help.
Gaozu greatly respected him.
He always called him Wang Sheng and established the reputation of Extending the Worthy because of Sengjiu.
When Sengjiu was in the southern region,
he betrothed a daughter of the Xie family to be his wife.
When he arrived in the capital,
he married the princess again. Xie wrote a five-syllable poem to give to him.
The poem said: Originally a silkworm on the cocoon,
Now a silk thread on the loom.
Following the path to victory,
Do you still remember the entangled time?
The princess replied on behalf of Sengjiu to Xie, saying:
The needle is the object that sews the thread.
The eye always accommodates the silk.
Obtaining silk, I sew the new,
How can I patch the old time?
Sengjiu was greatly ashamed and apologetic.
He then built the Zhengjue Temple to rest there.
Sengjiu remembered that his father suffered an unjust disaster.
He always had the intention of avenging Chu like Zixu.
He wore plain clothes all his life and did not enjoy music.
People of the time called him by this name.
When he first entered the country,
he did not eat mutton or yogurt, etc.
He always ate crucian carp soup.
When thirsty, he drank tea.
The young scholars in the capital said,
Suxi drinks one dou each time.
They called him a leaky cup.
After several years,
Suxi had a meal with Gaozu in the palace.
There was a lot of mutton, yogurt, and porridge.
Gaozu found it strange.
He said to Suxi,
You are from the Central Plains, where the food is delicious.
How does mutton compare to fish soup?
How does tea compare to yogurt?
Suxi replied,ğŸ”½Sheep are the best of land animals.
Fish are the best of water creatures.
What they like is different.
They are both considered delicacies.
In terms of taste, there is a great difference.ğŸ”½Sheep can be compared to the great states of Qi and Lu.
Fish can be compared to the small states of Zhu and Ju.
Only tea cannot compare to yogurt, which is a slave to it.
Gaozu laughed and raised his cup, saying,
Three by three, horizontally; two by two, vertically.
Who can discern it? I will give them a golden bell.
Imperial Censor Li Biao said:
An old woman selling wine pours from a jar.
A butcher cuts meat and weighs it together.
Right Attendant of the Chancellery Zhen Chen said:
A man from Wu floats on water and claims to be good.
A courtesan's son throws himself into the void.
Prince of Pengcheng Xie said:
I now understand this character, which is the character practice.
The founding emperor then gave a golden bell to Biao.
The court admired Biao's
intelligence and wisdom.
Zhen Chen's response was also quick.
Prince of Pengcheng said to Su:
You do not value the great states of Qi and Lu,
but love the small states of Zhu and Ju.
Su replied:
What is praised in the countryside cannot be disliked.
Prince of Pengcheng said again:
Look after me tomorrow.
I will prepare Zhu and Ju food for you.
There will also be whey.
Because of this, drinking tea was also called whey.
At that time, the Court Gentleman Liu Xiang admired the style of Liu Xiu.
He specialized in drinking tea.
The Prince of Pengcheng said to Xiang:
You do not admire the eight treasures of the king and nobles.
You like the water disaster of the blue-headed people.
There are men who chase smells on the sea.
In the village, there are women who learn to frown.
According to your words, this is exactly it.
In the Prince of Pengcheng's household, there was a Wu slave.
He used these words to tease him.
From then on, at the gatherings of the court nobility,
even if tea was served, they were ashamed and no longer ate it.
Only the people from the Jiangnan region who came to surrender liked it.
Later, Xiao Zhengde, the Prince of Xifeng, the son of Xiao Yan, surrendered.
At that time, Yuan Yi wanted to serve tea for him.
He first asked, How much water disaster do you have?
Xiao Zhengde did not understand Yuan Yi's meaning.
He replied, Your subordinate was born in a watery village.
Since establishing myself,
I have not encountered the difficulty of Yang Hou.
Yuan Yi and the guests at the gathering all laughed.
Longhua Temple, Zhiseng Temple, Baoen Temple, Jingsi Temple. Longhua Temple.
Established by the Prince of Guangling.
Zhiseng Temple.
Established by the Prince of Behai.
Both are east of Baoen Temple.
The monastic residences for Dharma activities are comparable to those of the Great Preceptor Qin.
Jingsi Temple.
All plant various fruits.
But the gardens and forests of these three temples are lush and prosperous.
No one can compete with them.
Guizheng Temple, four li outside Xuan Yang Gate.
It reaches the Luo River and a floating bridge is built.
This is the so-called Yong Bridge.
In the Shenguang era.
Chang Jing wrote a eulogy for the Wei River.
His words said:ğŸ”½The vast great river.
The clear Luo River flows swiftly.
The source leads to Mount Xiong'er.
The current controls the great ravine.ğŸ”½It receives the Gu River and releases the Yi River.ğŸ”½It passes through Zhou and Miao.
It recently reaches the Zong River.
It pays tribute to the sea in the distance.
The signs are only the food of the Luo River.
In reality, it is the same as the earth.
It responds to Zhang and Liu above.
Below, it is based on the Yellow River and Mount Song.
Cold and hot weather are in harmony.
The sun and moon are fused together.
The imperial era is a time of peace and prosperity.
The wind blows from the bottom of the box.
Facing Mount Song in the front.ğŸ”½With Mount Tai in the back.ğŸ”½Governing the eastern part of the mountain.
With the steep cliffs of the western border.
The land of the four dangers.
The hall of the six passages.
Relying on virtue, it is firm.
Losing the Way, it perishes.
Carefully observing the ancient lists, examining the ancient mounds.ğŸ”½Sometimes changing, sometimes reforming.
Sometimes simple, sometimes ornate.
The remaining nine states of the Zhou.
The end of the Han dynasty with three factions.ğŸ”½The Wei style is declining.
The Jin era is fading.
Heaven and earth manifest.
The Book of Changes receives the mandate.
The imperial establishment has an ultimate.
Divine power is unrivaled.
The Wei register looks up to heaven.
The mysterious talisman holds the mirror.
The imperial seal meets with prosperity.
The dragon chart receives the mandate.
Then, looking at the written rules.
Forever cherishing the precious determination.
Spreading this scenic trace.
Flowing the beautiful grand plan.
They have inherited our crowns and caps.
They are the true pivot of our spirits.
Water and land meet together.
Zhou and Zheng intersect.
Here, at the confluence of the Luo River,
I dare to announce to the central region.
On both the north and south banks, there are Huabiao pillars.
They are raised twenty zhang tall.
On top of the Huabiao pillars, there are phoenixes.
They seem to be about to soar into the sky.
South of Yong Bridge and north of Yuanqiu,
Between the Yi and Luo rivers,
Along the imperial road, there are four barbarian lodges.
To the east of the road, there are four lodges.
The first is called Guizheng.
The second is called Guide.
The third is called Muhua.
The fourth is called Muyi.
Those from Wu who surrendered to the state were housed in the Jinling Lodge.
After three years, they were given houses in the Guizheng Ward.
In the beginning of the Jingming era,
Xiao Baoyin, the Prince of Jian'an of the false state of Qi, came to surrender.
He was enfeoffed as the Marquis of Kuaiji.
A residence was built for him in the Guizheng Ward.
Later, his title was advanced to the Prince of Qi.
He married the Princess of Nanyang.
Bao Yin was ashamed to be in the same rank as the barbarians.
He asked the princess to inform Emperor Wu.
He requested to enter the city.
Emperor Wu followed his request.
He was granted a residence in Yong'an Lane.
In the fourth year of Zhengguang,
Xiao Zhengde, the Prince of Xifeng, the son of Xiao Yan, came to surrender.
He was placed in the Jinling Lodge.ğŸ”½A residence was built for him in Guizheng Lane.
Zhengde donated the residence to build Guizheng Temple.
Those from the northern barbarians who came to submit were placed in the Yanran Lodge.
After three years, they were granted residences in Guideri Lane.ğŸ”½In the first year of Zhengguang, the Ruru people arrived in the capital.
Jiuqu Anzhou came to court.
The officials did not know where to place him.
Chang Jing, the Court Gentleman for Ceremonials, proposed:ğŸ”½When the Shan Yuyuan of Xianbei came to court,
in the Jin dynasty he was placed below the Duke of State and Special Envoy.
Anzhou should be placed between the barbarian king and the General Who Resembles a Divine Response.
The court followed his proposal.
He was also placed in the Yanran Lodge.
He was granted a residence in Guideri Lane.
The chieftains of the northern barbarians sent their sons to serve as attendants.
They always came in autumn and left in spring.
Avoiding the heat of China.
At that time, people called them goose subjects.
Those from the eastern barbarians who came to submit were placed in the Fusang Pavilion.
They were given residences in the Muhua Ward.
Those from the western barbarians who came to submit were placed in the Qiaoyao Pavilion.
They were given residences in the Muyi Ward.
West of the Pamir Mountains,
as far as the Great Qin,
the hundreds of countries and thousands of cities all joyfully submitted.
Merchant Hu and peddlers rushed to the border every day.
It is said that throughout the world, they all enjoy the customs and culture of China.
Therefore, those who settled there were countless.
Thus, the people who submitted and assimilated were more than ten thousand households.
The gates and alleys were well-maintained, and the city gates were filled with people.
Green poplars shaded the streets, and green trees hung over the courtyards.
Rare goods from all over the world,
were all there.
A separate market was established south of Leishui,
called the Four-way Market.
The common people called it Yongqiao Market.
The fish of the Yi and Luo rivers were mostly sold here.
When officials and commoners needed sashimi,
they all went there to buy it.
The taste of the fish was very delicious.
The capital city said:
The carp of the Luo River and the sea bream of the Yi River are more expensive than cattle and sheep.
To the south of Yong Bridge, east of the road, there were two wards named White Elephant and Lion.
The white elephant was offered by the Hu King of the country of Qianluo in the second year of Yongping.
They were all furnished with five-colored screens and seven-treasure sitting beds, which could accommodate several people.
They were truly extraordinary objects.
The elephant was always raised in the Chuyuang Cao.
The elephant often destroyed houses and collapsed walls.
It ran out of the gate.
When it encountered a tree, it pulled it out.
When it met a wall, it also knocked it down.
The people were frightened.
They ran in all directions.
The Empress Dowager then moved the elephant to this ward.ğŸ”½As for the lion, it was offered by the Hu King of the country of Persia.
It was captured by the rebel Wan Hou Chou Nu.
It was kept in the enemy's camp.ğŸ”½At the end of Yong'an,
after Chou Nu was defeated, it finally reached the capital city.
Emperor Zhuang told the attendant Li or,
I have heard that when a tiger sees a lion, it must submit.
You can look for a lion.
Then he issued an edict to the counties near the mountains,
to capture tigers and send them.
Gongxian and Shanyang both sent two tigers and one leopard.
The emperor was in the Hualin Garden watching them.
Then the tigers and leopards saw the lion.
They all closed their eyes and did not dare to look up.
In the garden, there was originally a raised bear.
Its nature was very docile.
The emperor ordered it to be brought to try it.ğŸ”½The keeper led the blind bear to it.
Smelling the lion's breath, it was frightened and jumped around,
dragging its chain and running away.
The emperor laughed loudly.
In the first year of Putong, the Prince of Guangling ascended the throne.
The edict said,
Animals, when imprisoned, go against their nature.
They should be released back to the mountains and forests.
The lion should also be sent back to its homeland.
The envoy sent to deliver the lion went by the route of Persia, which was too far to reach.
He ended up killing the lion on the way and returned.
The authorities investigated and impeached him, considering his crime to be disobeying the imperial decree.
The Prince of Guangling said:
How can one be blamed for being a lion?
So he was pardoned.
Bodhi Temple Bodhi Temple.
It was established by Hu people from the Western Regions.
It was located in Muyi Lane.
The monk Datang dug up a tomb to get bricks.
He found a person and presented him.
At that time, the Empress Dowager and Emperor Ming were in the Huilintang Hall.
They considered it a strange phenomenon.
They said to the Chamberlain for Ceremonials Xu He:
Have there been such things since ancient times?
Xu He said:
In the past, when the Wei dynasty excavated a tomb, they found the house slave of Huo Guang's son-in-law Fan Mingyu.
He talked about the abdication and succession of the Han dynasty.
It matched the historical records.
This is nothing strange.
The Empress Dowager ordered Xu He to ask about his name and surname.
How many years had it been since he died?
What did he eat and drink?
The dead person said:ğŸ”½I am surnamed Cui.ğŸ”½My given name is Han.
My courtesy name is Zihong.
He was a person from Boling and Anding.
His father's name was Chang.
His mother's surname was Wei.
His family lived in Fuccai Lane, west of the city.
When he died, he was fifteen years old.
Now he is twenty-seven years old.
He has been underground for twelve years.
He always seems to be lying drunk, not eating anything.
Sometimes he goes out for walks.
Sometimes he encounters food and drink.
It is like in a dream, not very clear.
Later, he sent Zhang Xiuyin, a recorder in the Secretariat, to Fuccai Lane.
To inquire about Han's parents.
Sure enough, he found Cui Chang.
His wife, Wei Shi.
Xiuyin asked Chang:
Do you have a son who died?
Chang said: I have a son named Han who died at the age of fifteen.
Xiuyin said: He was possessed by someone.
Today he has revived.
He is in the Huayang Garden.
The master deliberately sent me here to inquire about him.
Chang was startled and frightened, saying:
I really don't have this son.
Just now I spoke erroneously.
Xiu and Yan truthfully reported what they had heard.
The empress sent Yan to send Han back home.
Chang heard that Han had arrived at the gate.
He lit a fire and held a knife in his hand.
The Wei family held a peach branch.
He said,
You don't need to come.
I am not your father and you are not my son.
Hurry up and leave quickly.
You can avoid misfortune.
Han then left and traveled to the capital.
He often stayed under the gate of a temple.
The Prince of Runan gave him a set of yellow clothes.
Han was afraid of the sun and did not dare to look up.
He was also afraid of water, fire, and weapons.
He always ran on the main road and stopped when tired, not walking slowly.
At that time, people still called him a ghost.
In the north of Tai City in Luoyang, there was a neighborhood called Fengzhongli.
The people in the neighborhood often sold funeral supplies and coffins.
Han said,
Make a coffin out of cypress wood.
Do not use mulberry wood for the frame.
People asked him the reason.
Han said,ğŸ”½The reason is like this.
I am underground.
I see people dispatching ghost soldiers.
There is a ghost who complains,
saying he should be exempted because of the paulownia coffin.
The officer says,
Although you have a paulownia coffin, since the coffin frame is made of mulberry wood, you are not exempted.
People in the capital heard this and the price of paulownia wood soared.
People suspected that the coffin seller was making a profit.
This is what Han Fan said.ğŸ”½Gao Yang Wang Temple.
The residence of Gao Yang Wang Yong.
Three li outside Jin Yang Gate, west of the imperial road.
Yong was harmed by Er Zhu Rong.
He donated the residence to be made into a temple.
During the Zheng Guang period.
Yong was the chancellor.
Provided with a carriage, feathered banners, drums and horns, tiger guards, and a hundred swords.
Wealthy to the extreme as a human minister.
Rich as the mountains and seas.
The residence and house were equal to the imperial palace.
White halls with vermilion railings.
Deep and connected.ğŸ”½Flying eaves and inverted roofs.
Crowded and all-encompassing.
Six thousand servants.
five hundred courtesans.
Sui pearls shining in the sun.
Luo robes following the wind.
Since the Han and Jin dynasties.
The extravagance of the kings has never been like this.
When going out, the carriages make a sound on the road, and the cultural articles form a line.
The sound of the naus and blowing is heard.
The sound of the reed pipes is mournful and turns.
When entering, the singing girls and dancing girls strike the zither and blow the sheng.
The silk and bamboo play alternately.
It continues through the night until the day is over.
The bamboo groves and fish ponds.
Are comparable to the imperial garden.
The fragrant grass is piled up, and the precious trees form a continuous shade.
Yong likes to eat and drink.
He treats himself with great generosity.
In one day, he must spend tens of thousands of cash.
The delicacies from the sea and land.
Are placed in front of him.
The Marquis of Chenliu, Li Chong, said to people:
The Gao Yang of one day is equal to my thousand days.
Chong was the Minister of the Ministry of Personnel and the Minister of Education.
He should also exhaust the world.
He had a thousand servants.
But he was very frugal and stingy.
Always wearing coarse clothes and eating coarse food, never meat.
Only had chives and pickled vegetables.
Li Yuanyou, a guest of the court, told people:
The Duke Li has eighteen kinds of food for each meal.
People asked him why.
Li Yuanyou said:
Two nines is eighteen.
Those who heard it laughed.
The world took it as a mockery.
After Yong died, all the concubines were ordered to enter the Buddhist order.
Some were married.
The beautiful woman Xu Yuehua was good at playing the qin.
She could sing the song of the Mingfei leaving the border.
Those who heard it could not help but change their expressions.
During the Yong'an period,
she became a concubine of Wei General Yuan Shisun.
Her residence was near Qingyang Gate.
Xu often played the qin and sang.
Her mournful voice reached the clouds.
Those who passed by to listen gradually formed a crowd.
Xu often said to Shisun:
The king has two beautiful concubines.ğŸ”½One is named Xiurong.
The other is named Yanzizi.
They all had moth-like eyebrows, snow-white teeth, and pure looks that could captivate a city.
Xiu Rong was also able to compose the Green Water Song.
Her enchanting figure was good at the Hu Feng dance.
They both captivated the inner quarters and their favor surpassed that of all the other concubines.
Shi Yuan heard of this and thus always had the Green Water and Hu Feng tunes played.
To the north of Gao Yang's residence was Zhong Gan Li.
In the lane lived Xun Ying's son Wen, who was thirteen years old.
He was intelligent and discerning from a young age.
His spirit was extraordinary.
Even Huang Wan and Wen Ju were no match for him.
In the beginning of the Zheng Guang era,
Pan Chong He of Guang Zong,
lectured on the Spring and Autumn of the Duke of Zhou in Zhao Yi Lane in the east of the city.
Wen, the son of Xun Ying, attended the lectures with his head covered and learned from Chong He.
At that time, Li Cai of Zhao Jun asked Wen, the son of Xun Ying,
Where does Master Xun live?
Wen, the son of Xun Ying, replied,
I live in Zhong Gan Lane.
Cai asked, Where is it going?
Wen replied, It goes south of the city.
South of the city is the Si Yi Pavilion.
Cai used this to ridicule him.
Ziwu replied:
The land of Guoyang is superior.
Why are you surprised?
If you say the rivers and valleys of Yiluo are steep and dangerous,
Speaking of old matters, the Lingtai Stone Classics,
The beauty of Zhaoti,
Repaying kindness, Jingming,
Rich and noble in the present world,
Gaoyang and Guangping,
The customs of the four directions,
Ten thousand countries and a thousand cities.
If we discuss people and things, I have you, but you don't have me.
Cai had nothing to respond with.
Chonghe said:ğŸ”½You scholars from Ying are as sharp as needles,
The scholars from Yan and Zhao are as dull as hammers.
This is not an empty statement.
Everyone in the academy laughed.
Chongxu Temple Chongxu Temple was located to the west of the city.
It was the Leap Dragon Pavilion of the Han Dynasty.
In the ninth year of Yanxi,
Emperor Huan of the Han Dynasty made offerings to Laozi at the Leap Dragon Garden.
The garden had a seat with a flower canopy,
And used the music of the suburban sacrifice.
This was the site.
When the Gaozu moved the capital,
The land was given to the people.
Those who rested there often saw strange apparitions.
Therefore, people all left it.
